title: Reorganize the .qrc file(s)
message:
Reorganize the .qrc file(s)

Split the single .qrc file up into audio, graphics, qml and
translations. That increases build speed after changes just in
.qml files.

List each file separately in each .qrc instead of the semi-
supported folder name definition. That improves support by Qt
Creator's .qrc file upport in the project tree. Also, it allows
to use the Qt Quick Compiler.

title: Major cleanup of the QtQuick-2 branch
message:
Major cleanup of the QtQuick-2 branch

- using QQmlApplicationEngine instead of qtquick2appviewer
- Using .qrc based instead of file based deployment
- Removing BlackBerry support, since it's unmaintained
- Removing dead platforms support (Symbian/MeeGo)
- Removing c++-based Feedback class. Now all in QML.

title: No viewer.setGeometry call for Android
message: No viewer.setGeometry call for Android

title: Remove hack with explicit screenWidth/screenHeight
message:
Remove hack with explicit screenWidth/screenHeight

That was needed as workaround in early Qt 5 alphas to
prevent several scene resizes on init which trigger
unneeded ImageProvider::requestPixmap calls.

In today's Qt 5 that workaround actually added extra
calls of ImageProvider::requestPixmap, and without
it, it is just one call. Win.

Using png (instead of svg) for the "correct" effect star particle.

on Android.

Second, that particle image is apparently not cached, and loaded
each time a button is created. I assume that in this particular
case png is faster than svg.

title: Include our own copy of QtSvg.
message:
Include our own copy of QtSvg.

It is used on platforms where Qt comes without QtSvg.

The Svg generation, aswell as the QWidget and
QGraphicsViewItem have been stripped out.

The copied sources are minimally modified in order not to
use private Qt Api. Therefore, css-style support has been
removed, since it required the private stylesheet classes.
To convert an Svg file from css to xml style (which is by
the way faster to parse), the tool "Scour" can be used.
   http://www.codedread.com/scour/

title: Launcher icon in the new "Anna"-look
message:
Launcher icon in the new "Anna"-look

With rounded background shape.

Of course I had to create the .svg from scratch, myself[*].
There is tons of information about the new launcher icons
on developer.nokia.com. Even template icons for download,
but these are not available in the obvious .svg format
but instead as Adobe Indesign (expensive software) files.

That seems bizarre, but after all this is consistent
Symbian developer experience ;)

[*] Of course, I did not create it from scratch ;)
I rather stole it from the awesome TwimGo and tweaked it.

title: Optimization of SVG files.
message:
Optimization of SVG files.

The "Save As"->"Optimized SVG", scour based plugin of
Inkscape 4.7 does a great job at squeezing the air out
of .svg files. Even better... it converts inline styles
to xml attributes.
Both facts should increase the speed of Qt loading the
SVG images.

Since the optimization is unfortunately destructive
(an Inkscape->Scour->Inkscape round trip adds artifacts),
we keep separate copies of the originals and optimized
SVGs.

title: Major refactoring and cleanup
message:
Major refactoring and cleanup

The main QML data model is now only an integer. And the data
is now stored in a central javascript datastructure, which
gets incrementally populated.
Before, the QML data model was populated with 50 exercises
when starting a lesson. That was to slow on a phone for too
few excercises.

Also the new strucure will allow a mixed lesson with mixed
exercises from all other available lessons.

title: Added a horse.
message: Added a horse.

title: Endless background without the 1000000px BG image trick
message:
Endless background without the 1000000px BG image trick

Those 1000000px were of course only virtual and the small
image was tiled horizontally. But in some OpenGL
implementations, this lead to rounding errors in the texture
mapping (I think) and the result was bad.

Using another workaround, now, which has magic code which I
will never touch anymore.

app.

side effects. Therefore, I did my own poor man's slice.
